claim: Despite the apparent equivalence between options, participants preferred to take the final turn rather than the two turns that were available earlier (see Figure 1 for abstraction of maze).
title: Figure 1.
caption: (Left) Overhead view of the fish tank during a test trial. There were three possible turn options, all of equivalent length. During familiarization, the middle two walls, which create the turns, were not present. (Right) Schematic of the maze used and the proposed maze with a shortcut. Photo: Victoria Braithwaite; diagrams: Natalie Schwob.

claim: Our proposed study of flexibility utilizes the action continuation heuristic in a maze navigation task with fish (see Figure 1).

caption: (Left) Overhead view of the fish tank during a test trial. There were three possible turn options, all of equivalent length. claim: From there, a longer arm led to the exit into a goal compartment where the fish received food (see Figure 1).
